intro: Engelhardia oreomunnea, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a rough, hairy texture. Engelhardia oreomunnea thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas at higher elevations.
